thread.title: There Is a Café Inspired by Kate Middleton in Australia
thread.title_full: There Is a Café Inspired by Kate Middleton in Australia

title: There Is a Café Inspired by Kate Middleton in Australia
text: There Is a Café Inspired by Kate Middleton, and It’s Surprisingly Chic February 7, 2017 4:53 PM 1 / 9 Photo: Getty Images For those obsessed with the British royals, and with Kate Middleton in particular, it turns out that Kensington Palace isn’t the only must-visit. In fact, one of the best spots for fans of the Duchess is not even located in the U.K. Middletown , an Australian café, was entirely inspired by the future queen of England. And while the Melbourne café’s name is a clear indicator of its focus, its nod to the Duchess of Cambridge doesn’t end there. The predominant color of the modern eatery is royal blue. The diamond-shaped tiles are meant to mimic those at Westminster Abbey, where the wedding of Kate Middleton and Prince William took place. And the café’s walls have an illustration of the Duchess’s sapphire engagement ring, which once belonged to her late mother-in-law, Princess Diana. But as trite as this concept may sound, the café itself is the picture of chic. Just take a casual scroll through its Instagram feed , and you’ll find plenty of marble countertops, modern light fixtures, and freshly cut flowers. Breakfast is served all day, and includes a variety of toasts, as well as chia-seed pudding, eggs Benedict, and an item called Trio Mushrooms. Overall, pretty appealing. So, brunch in Melbourne next weekend? Maybe. In This Story: Kate Middleton Recommended For You
